intro: Astrantia ossica, commonly known as the mountain astrantia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly ovate to heart-shaped. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers in late summer, which are arranged in umbels. Its flowering period extends from July to September, and it thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. Astrantia ossica is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
